what.lead: Protect both domestic and foreign workers against the negative effects of economic migration,
what.text: by applying minimal harmonization among all European countries ensuring that access to basic social, legal and medical services is guaranteed.

what.lead: Turn Europe into a talent and innovation hub,
what.text: by making it simpler and more attractive to obtain an expert visa, especially after acquiring a university degree from an EU Member State.
by developing a specific visa that will be made available to temporary foreign workers.

what.lead: Ensure that countries of origin and European countries benefit from temporary economic migration,
what.text: by aligning the interest of both and by involving all relevant stakeholders (e.g., employers and trade unions) in the policy making process.
